meanings.definition: Not solid or stable; weak or shaky.
meanings.sent1: The old bridge showed signs of unsoundness, with cracks and creaks.
meanings.sent2: The unsoundness of the chair was evident when it collapsed under minimal weight.
meanings.sent3: The unsoundness of the plan became apparent when it fell apart at the first hurdle.
meanings.sent4: The unsoundness of the foundation led to the entire building crumbling down.
meanings.sent5: The unsoundness of the makeshift ladder made climbing it a risky endeavor.

meanings.definition: Not mentally or physically healthy; not in good condition.
meanings.sent1: His unsoundness of mind was evident in his confused and erratic behavior.
meanings.sent2: The doctor diagnosed the patient with unsoundness due to lack of proper nutrition.
meanings.sent3: Despite his unsoundness, he always managed to find humor in every situation.
meanings.sent4: The unsoundness of her body prevented her from participating in the marathon.
meanings.sent5: The unsoundness of the old car was evident in its constant breakdowns.

meanings.definition: Not based on sound reasoning or judgment.
meanings.sent1: The unsoundness of his argument was clear when he contradicted himself.
meanings.sent2: Her decision to quit her job seemed to stem from unsoundness rather than logic.
meanings.sent3: The unsoundness of his plan was evident when it failed to consider basic risks.
meanings.sent4: The unsoundness of the conspiracy theory was apparent to anyone with critical thinking.
meanings.sent5: The unsoundness of the investment scheme became obvious when it collapsed overnight.
